lead_paragraph: The prosecutions resemble the strategy used by the federal government to go after New York crime families, some experts say.

byline.contributor: Fernanda Santos reported from Hildale, and Julie Turkewitz from Denver.
byline.original: By FERNANDA SANTOS and JULIE TURKEWITZ

headline.print_headline: Fraud Arrests May Be Turning Point for Polygamist Sect
headline.main: Fraud Arrests May Be Turning Point for Polygamist Sect

snippet: The prosecutions resemble the strategy used by the federal government to go after New York crime families, some experts say.
abstract: Federal authorities and sheriff's deputies raid businesses in Mormon stronghold of Hildale, Utah, arresting 11 sect leaders and others on charges of fraudulent food stamp transactions and money-laundering; raids, in combination with pending discrimination trial, may signal turning point in government's handling of polygamist sect.
